edu.gcu.cst341.service

Class BankService

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gcu.cst341.service.BankService

  • @Service
public class BankService
extends java.lang.Object
    BankService provides methods and business logic for transactions The actual account computations occur in the account classes Checking, Saving, and Loan

      • getMoney

        public java.text.DecimalFormat getMoney()

        the money

      • setMoney

        public void setMoney(java.text.DecimalFormat money)
        Parameters:

      • doTransaction

        public int doTransaction(Customer cust,
                         java.lang.String accountType,
                         int transType,
                         double amount)
        Executes a deposit or withdrawal from any of the three account types (Checking, Saving, or Loan)
        Parameters:
        cust - the current Customer object
        accountType - the type of account for the transaction ("chk, "sav", or "loan")
        transType - the type of transaction (+1 = deposit, -1 = withdrawal, 0 = transfer)
        amount - the dollar amount of the transaction
        Returns:
        the number of records updated

      • doCheckingOverdraft

        public int doCheckingOverdraft(Customer cust)
        Writes an overdraft transaction to the database
        Parameters:
        cust - the current Customer object
        Returns:
        the number of records written (1 if successful, 0 if not)

      • doTransfer

        public int doTransfer(Customer cust,
                      java.lang.String fromAccount,
                      double amount,
                      java.lang.String toAccount)
        Executes a transfer between two accounts
        Parameters:
        cust - the current logged-in Customer object
        fromAccount - the account type from which funds are taken
        amount - the amount of the transfer
        toAccount - the account type into which funds are put
        Returns:
        the number of records written to the database

      • validateWithdrawal

        public boolean validateWithdrawal(Customer cust,
                                  java.lang.String accountType,
                                  double amount)
        Validates a withdrawal amount against the balance of record from the database by account type
        Parameters:
        cust - the current Customer object
        accountType - the type of account for the transaction ("chk, "sav", or "loan")
        amount - the requested withdrawal amount
        Returns:
        true if the amount requested is valid for the account or false if not

      • validateCashAdvancePayment

        public boolean validateCashAdvancePayment(Customer cust,
                                          double amount)
        Validates the business rule that cash advance payments (deposits) must be less than the outstanding balance
        Parameters:
        cust - the current Customer
        amount - the requested amount of payment to the cash advance
        Returns:
        true if the rule is satisfied, false otherwise

      • computeLoanAvailable

        public double computeLoanAvailable(Loan loan)
        Helper method to compute how much credit is available on a Loan object
        Parameters:
        loan - the Loan object for computing available credit
        Returns:
        the amount of credit available

      • transListByAccount

        public java.util.List<Transaction> transListByAccount(java.util.List<Transaction> allTransactions,
                                                      char acctPrefix)
        Helper method that separates the complete transaction list for a customer Id into lists by account type
        Parameters:
        allTransactions - the complete list of transactions for a customer Id
        acctPrefix - the account type prefix ('C' = checking, 'S' = savings, 'L' = loan)
        Returns:
        a list of transactions filtered by account prefix

      • stringToDouble

        public double stringToDouble(java.lang.String amount)
        Converts a String value that represents a number into a double, if possible If not possible, catches the thrown exceptions
        Parameters:
        amount - the String amount to convert
        Returns:
        the double representation of the String if successful or -1 if not possible
